Pre-Game Insights: Virat Kohli is on the verge of breaking Mahela Jayawardene's record for the most runs in T20 World Cups.
Rilee Rossouw is only the second player to score back-to-back T20I centuries.
South Africa may drop one of their specialist spinners to bring back a fourth fast bowler, possibly leaving out Temba Bavuma.
The pitch in Perth offers pace, bounce, and early swing, favoring quick bowlers.
The average first innings score is 143, and 200 has only been breached once at this venue.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India and South Africa have met five times in T20 World Cups, but not since 2014.
South Africa's only victory over India in T20 World Cups was in 2009.
South Africa were the last team to beat India, in a dead rubber in their three-match series earlier this month.
